00007 void BdkDP::drawBoundary(int npoints, 
00008                          int color, 
00009                          int width, 
00010                          int style) {
00011 
00012   double space = edge() / npoints;
00013   for (int i = 0; i < npoints; ++i){
00014     double x1 = space * i;
00015     double max1 = s13Max(x1);
00016     double min1 = s13Min(x1);
00017 
00018     double x2 = space * (i+1);
00019     double max2 = s13Max(x2);
00020     double min2 = s13Min(x2);
00021 
00022     if (min1 != 0 && max1 != 0 && min2 != 0 && max2 != 0) {
00023       line(x1, max1, x2, max2, color, width, style);
00024       line(x1, min1, x2, min2, color, width, style);
00025     }
00026     else { // for the extreme vertical parts of the boundary:
00027       line(x1, max1, x1, min1, color, width, style);
00028       line(x2, max2, x2, min2, color, width, style);
00029     }
00030   }
00031 }

00035 TLine * BdkDP::line(const BdkP2 & p1, const BdkP2 & p2, 
00036                     int color, int width, int style) {
00037 
00038   return line(p1.s12(), p1.s13(), p2.s12(), p2.s13(), 
00039               color, width, style);
00040 }

00044 TLine * BdkDP::line(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, 
00045                     int color, int width, int style) {
00046   TLine * result = new TLine(x1, y1, x2, y2);
00047   result->SetLineColor(color);
00048   result->SetLineWidth(width);
00049   result->SetLineStyle(style);
00050   result->Draw();
00051   return result;
00052 }
00053 
00054 
00055 TLine * BdkDP::lineEdge(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, 
00056                         int color, int width, 
00057                         int style) {
00058   // Draw a line covering the two points and extending all the way to
00059   // the axes and to edge():
00060   if (x1==x2) {
00061     // vertical line:
00062     if (x1 < edge() && x1 >0){
00063       return line(x1, 0, x1, edge(), color, width, style);
00064     }
00065   }
00066   else if (y1==y2) {
00067     // horizontal line:
00068     if (y1 < edge() && y1 >0){
00069       return line(0, y1, edge(), y1, color, width, style);
00070     }
00071   }
00072   else {
00073     // diagonal line:
00074     double slope = (y2-y1)/(x2-x1);
00075     return lineEdgeSlope(x1, y1, slope, color, width, style);
00076   }
00077   return 0;
00078 }  
00079 
00080 
00081 
00082 TLine * BdkDP::lineEdgeSlope(double x1, double y1, double slope, 
00083                              int color, int width, 
00084                              int style) {
00085   // There are four possible intercepts with the boundaries:
00086   BdkP2 intLeft  (0,                         y1 - slope * x1);
00087   BdkP2 intRight (edge(),                    y1 + slope * (edge() - x1));
00088   BdkP2 intBottom(x1 - y1 / slope,           0);
00089   BdkP2 intTop   (x1 + (edge() - y1) / slope,  edge());
00090 
00091   // The correct intercepts are the ones whose coordinates are between
00092   // 0 and edge(). 
00093   BdkP2 * ints[2] = {0,0};
00094   int index = -1;
00095 
00096   if (inBox(intLeft))                {ints[++index] = &intLeft;}
00097   if (inBox(intTop))                 {ints[++index] = &intTop;}
00098   if (inBox(intRight)  && index < 1) {ints[++index] = &intRight;}
00099   if (inBox(intBottom) && index < 1) {ints[++index] = &intBottom;}
00100   // Above, need to check index<1, since if the intercept is at the 
00101   // corner then two intercepts would be inBox()
00102 
00103   if (1 == index && (0 != ints[0] && 0 != ints[1])) {
00104     return line(*(ints[0]), *(ints[1]), color, width, style);
00105   }
00106 
00107   return 0;
00108 }

00111 
00112 Bool_t BdkDP::inBox(const BdkP2 & point){ 
00113   if (point.s12() >= 0      && point.s13() >= 0 &&
00114       point.s12() <= edge() && point.s13() <= edge()) {
00115     return kTRUE;
00116   }
00117   return kFALSE;
00118 }

00120 
00121 
00122 Bool_t BdkDP::inDalitz(const BdkP2 & point){ 
00123   const double s12 = point.s12();
00124   const double s13 = point.s13();
00125 
00126   // kinematic limits
00127   Double_t m13High = s13Max(s12);
00128   if (m13High<=0) return kFALSE;
00129 
00130   Double_t m13Low = s13Min(s12);
00131   if (m13Low<=0) return kFALSE; 
00132 
00133   // decide
00134   if ( (s13 < m13Low) || (s13 > m13High)) return kFALSE;
00135 
00136   return kTRUE;
00137 }
00138 
00139 
00140 // A locally used squaring function:
00141 static double sqr(double d) {return d*d;}
00142 
00143 
00144 Double_t BdkDP::s13Max(Double_t s12){
00145   if ((s12 < sqr(m1()+m2())) || (s12>sqr(mD()-m3()))) return 0;
00146   
00147   // Energies of particles 1 and 3 in s12 restframe
00148   Double_t e1star = (s12 - m2sq() + m1sq()) / (2.0*sqrt(s12));
00149   Double_t e3star = (mDsq() - s12 - m3sq()) / (2.0*sqrt(s12));
00150   
00151   return sqr(e1star+e3star)-sqr(sqrt(e1star*e1star-m1sq())
00152                                 -sqrt(e3star*e3star - m3sq()));
00153 }
00154 
00155 Double_t BdkDP::s13Min(Double_t s12){
00156   if ((s12<sqr(m1()+m2())) || (s12>sqr(mD()-m3()))) return 0;
00157   
00158   // Energies of particles 1 and 3 in s12 restframe
00159   Double_t e1star = (s12 - m2sq() + m1sq()) / (2.0*sqrt(s12));
00160   Double_t e3star = (mDsq() - s12 - m3sq()  ) / (2.0*sqrt(s12));
00161   
00162   return sqr(e1star+e3star)-sqr(sqrt(e1star*e1star-m1sq())
00163                                 +sqrt(e3star*e3star - m3sq()));
00164 }

00167 TLine * BdkDP::drawE12Line() {
00168   return lineEdgeSlope(symValue(), symValue(), 
00169                        -0.5, kGreen, 2, 2);
00170 }

00173 TLine * BdkDP::drawE13Line() {
00174   return lineEdgeSlope(symValue(), symValue(), 
00175                        -2, kGreen, 2, 2);

00179 TLine * BdkDP::drawE23Line() {
00180   return lineEdgeSlope(symValue(), symValue(), 
00181                        1, kGreen, 2, 2);
